D3-ANCI.name: Authentication Cache Invalidation
D3-ANCI.desc: Removing tokens or credentials from an authentication cache to prevent further user associated account accesses.

D3-DTP.name: Domain Trust Policy
D3-DTP.desc: Restricting inter-domain trust by modifying domain configuration.

D3-UAP.name: User Account Permissions
D3-UAP.desc: Restricting a user account's access to resources.

D3-LFP.name: Local File Permissions
D3-LFP.desc: Restricting access to a local file by configuring operating system functionality.

D3-MAC.name: Mandatory Access Control
D3-MAC.desc: Controlling access to local computer system resources with kernel-level capabilities.

D3-SCP.name: System Configuration Permissions
D3-SCP.desc: Restricting system configuration modifications to a specific user or group of users.

D3-NTA.name: Network Traffic Analysis
D3-NTA.desc: Analyzing intercepted or summarized computer network traffic to detect unauthorized activity.

D3-DNSAL.name: DNS Allowlisting
D3-DNSAL.desc: Permitting only approved domains and their subdomains to be resolved.

D3-DNSDL.name: DNS Denylisting
D3-DNSDL.desc: Blocking DNS Network Traffic based on criteria such as IP address, domain name, or DNS query type.

D3-FA.name: File Analysis
D3-FA.desc: File Analysis is an analytic process to determine a file's status. For example: virus, trojan, benign, malicious, trusted, unauthorized, sensitive, etc.

D3-ITF.name: Inbound Traffic Filtering
D3-ITF.desc: Restricting network traffic originating from untrusted networks destined towards a private host or enclave.

D3-OTF.name: Outbound Traffic Filtering
D3-OTF.desc: Restricting network traffic originating from a private host or enclave destined towards untrusted networks.

D3-UA.name: URL Analysis
D3-UA.desc: Determining if a URL is benign or malicious by analyzing the URL or its components.

D3-BA.name: Bootloader Authentication
D3-BA.desc: Cryptographically authenticating the bootloader software before system boot.

D3-DLIC.name: Driver Load Integrity Checking
D3-DLIC.desc: Ensuring the integrity of drivers loaded during initialization of the operating system.

D3-PSEP.name: Process Segment Execution Prevention
D3-PSEP.desc: Preventing execution of any address in a memory region other than the code segment.

D3-DAM.name: Domain Account Monitoring
D3-DAM.desc: Monitoring the existence of or changes to Domain User Accounts.

D3-LAM.name: Local Account Monitoring
D3-LAM.desc: Analyzing local user accounts to detect unauthorized activity.

D3-SPP.name: Strong Password Policy
D3-SPP.desc: Modifying system configuration to increase password strength.

D3-OTP.name: One-time Password
D3-OTP.desc: A one-time password is valid for only one user authentication.

D3-PH.name: Platform Hardening
D3-PH.desc: Hardening components of a Platform with the intention of making them more difficult to exploit.

D3-BDI.name: Broadcast Domain Isolation
D3-BDI.desc: Broadcast isolation restricts the number of computers a host can contact on their LAN.

D3-ET.name: Encrypted Tunnels
D3-ET.desc: Encrypted encapsulation of routable network traffic.

D3-ISVA.name: Inbound Session Volume Analysis
D3-ISVA.desc: Analyzing inbound network session or connection attempt volume.

D3-MFA.name: Multi-factor Authentication
D3-MFA.desc: Requiring proof of two or more pieces of evidence in order to authenticate a user.

D3-EAL.name: Executable Allowlisting
D3-EAL.desc: Using a digital signature to authenticate a file before opening.

D3-EDL.name: Executable Denylisting
D3-EDL.desc: Blocking the execution of files on a host in accordance with defined application policy rules.

D3-IOPR.name: IO Port Restriction
D3-IOPR.desc: Limiting access to computer input/output (IO) ports to restrict unauthorized devices.

D3-NI.name: Network Isolation
D3-NI.desc: Network Isolation techniques prevent network hosts from accessing non-essential system network resources.

D3-AL.name: Account Locking
D3-AL.desc: The process of temporarily disabling user accounts on a system or domain.

D3-ANET.name: Authentication Event Thresholding
D3-ANET.desc: Collecting authentication events, creating a baseline user profile, and determining whether authentication events are consistent with the baseline profile.

D3-ACH.name: Application Configuration Hardening
D3-ACH.desc: Modifying an application's configuration to reduce its attack surface.

D3-SFA.name: System File Analysis
D3-SFA.desc: Monitoring system files such as authentication databases, configuration files, system logs, and system executables for modification or tampering.

D3-AZET.name: Authorization Event Thresholding
D3-AZET.desc: Collecting authorization events, creating a baseline user profile, and determining whether authorization events are consistent with the baseline profile.

D3-JFAPA.name: Job Function Access Pattern Analysis
D3-JFAPA.desc: Detecting anomalies in user access patterns by comparing user access activity to behavioral profiles that categorize users by role such as job title, function, department.

D3-RAPA.name: Resource Access Pattern Analysis
D3-RAPA.desc: Analyzing the resources accessed by a user to identify unauthorized activity.

D3-SDA.name: Session Duration Analysis
D3-SDA.desc: Analyzing the duration of user sessions in order to detect unauthorized activity.

D3-UDTA.name: User Data Transfer Analysis
D3-UDTA.desc: Analyzing the amount of data transferred by a user.

D3-UGLPA.name: User Geolocation Logon Pattern Analysis
D3-UGLPA.desc: Monitoring geolocation data of user logon attempts and comparing it to a baseline user behavior profile to identify anomalies in logon location.

D3-WSAA.name: Web Session Activity Analysis
D3-WSAA.desc: Monitoring changes in user web session behavior by comparing current web session activity to a baseline behavior profile or a catalog of predetermined malicious behavior.

D3-DENCR.name: Disk Encryption
D3-DENCR.desc: Encrypting a hard disk partition to prevent cleartext access to a file system.

D3-FE.name: File Encryption
D3-FE.desc: Encrypting a file using a cryptographic key.

D3-MENCR.name: Message Encryption
D3-MENCR.desc: Encrypting a message body using a cryptographic key.

D3-HBPI.name: Hardware-based Process Isolation
D3-HBPI.desc: Preventing one process from writing to the memory space of another process through hardware based address manager implementations.

D3-SCF.name: System Call Filtering
D3-SCF.desc: Configuring a kernel to use an allow or deny list to filter kernel api calls.

D3-SBV.name: Service Binary Verification
D3-SBV.desc: Analyzing changes in service binary files by comparing to a source of truth.

D3-TBI.name: TPM Boot Integrity
D3-TBI.desc: Assuring the integrity of a platform by demonstrating that the boot process starts from a trusted combination of hardware and software and continues until the operating system has fully booted and applications are running. Sometimes called Static Root of Trust Measurement (STRM).

D3-DA.name: Dynamic Analysis
D3-DA.desc: Executing or opening a file in a synthetic "sandbox" environment to determine if the file is a malicious program or if the file exploits another program such as a document reader.

D3-FCR.name: File Content Rules
D3-FCR.desc: Employing a pattern matching rule language to analyze files.

D3-FH.name: File Hashing
D3-FH.desc: Employing file hash comparisons to detect known malware.

D3-PA.name: Process Analysis
D3-PA.desc: Process Analysis consists of observing a running application process and analyzing it to watch for certain behaviors or conditions which may indicate adversary activity. Analysis can occur inside of the process or through a third-party monitoring application. Examples include monitoring system and privileged calls, monitoring process initiation chains, and memory boundary allocations.

D3-SSC.name: Shadow Stack Comparisons
D3-SSC.desc: Comparing a call stack in system memory with a shadow call stack maintained by the processor to determine unauthorized shellcode activity.

D3-AH.name: Application Hardening
D3-AH.desc: Application Hardening makes an executable application more resilient to a class of exploits which either introduce new code or execute unwanted existing code. These techniques may be applied at compile-time or on an application binary.

D3-EHPV.name: Exception Handler Pointer Validation
D3-EHPV.desc: Validates that a referenced exception handler pointer is a valid exception handler.

D3-SU.name: Software Update
D3-SU.desc: Replacing old software on a computer system component.

D3-CP.name: Certificate Pinning
D3-CP.desc: Persisting either a server's X509 certificate or their public key and comparing that to server's presented identity to allow for greater client confidence in the remote server's identity for SSL connections.

D3-DE.name: Decoy Environment
D3-DE.desc: A Decoy Environment comprises hosts and networks for the purposes of deceiving an attacker.

D3-DO.name: Decoy Object
D3-DO.desc: A Decoy Object is created and deployed for the purposes of deceiving attackers.
